item.title: I Turned My To-Do List Into a To-Read List
item.description: I have several experiences of trying some 100-day-challenges, and unfortunately, most of them failed. I switched to the 30-day-challenges, but I still failed. When I skipped one day, I quickly lost the passion for catching up on the next day. Such a vicious circle certainly dulls my motivation. It hurts. At a certain point in my life (Actually, just yesterday), I made a pivot change in my To-Do list app (I use “Todoist”).

item.title: Rolling Up the Town: Story of a Small Mobile Grocery Store in Mie, Japan
item.description: One of my pastimes is watching documentaries about culture and humanities. Among various channels, NHK’s documentaries never let me down. And the good thing is, some programs can be streamed within a certain period on NHK World. Recently, I have been obsessed with a program called “Hometown Stories” — stories about local people around Japan. I haven’t watched much though, some stories have left me with a touching impression. One episode of the show is called “A ‘Truckful’ of food and smile.

item.title: How to update this blog (built with Hugo & GitHub Pages)
item.description: #1 Write a post Open cmd，cd to hugo blog local folder. hugo new posts/"new post.md" Open “new post”. Start writing by using a markdown editor (recommended). #2 Preview hugo server -D Make sure everything works fine. Change draft:true to draft:false in the metadata section of the post. #3 Git update Run hugo hugo Go to “public” folder, push to GitHub. cd public git add . git commit -m "xxxxx" (git pull) git push Go to the blog url to see the final result.
